meanings.definition: The state or position of being a prior.
meanings.sent1: In the monastery, the priorships is held by the most respected monk.
meanings.sent2: The priorships of the abbey is a position of great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The priorships of the group was passed down from generation to generation.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the priorships of a leader, guiding others with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The priorships of the captain was evident in the way he commanded the ship.

meanings.definition: The office or rank of a prior.
meanings.sent1: The priorships in the church is bestowed upon the most dedicated priest.
meanings.sent2: He aspired to attain the priorships in the monastery one day.
meanings.sent3: The priorships of the head librarian included organizing bookshelves with precision.
meanings.sent4: She wore the priorships of authority with grace and humility.
meanings.sent5: The priorships of the mayor was evident in the way he addressed the town.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a prior.
meanings.sent1: The priorships of the principal at the school lasts for five years.
meanings.sent2: During the priorships of the president, many changes were implemented.
meanings.sent3: The priorships of the team captain was marked by victories and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: She completed her priorships as treasurer with diligence and honesty.
meanings.sent5: The priorships of the CEO required making tough decisions for the company.
